title: List of humans
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

The benchmark species against which others are compared, **humans** play a major, though somewhat inconspicuous role in the far-flung realms of *Dungeon Crawl*. Aside from a somewhat increased presence as specialized guardians of [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), humans tend to be scattered widely across the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") and its [branches](/Branch "Branch"), arriving most often as unique, individually-named foes rather than as generic types of monster - they are arguably the one species best represented in this way.

The following is a list of humans appearing as monsters in all their various incarnations across *Dungeon Crawl*:

## Contents

- [1 Generic humans](#Generic_humans)
  - [1.1 Generic human variants](#Generic_human_variants)

- [2 Human types](#Human_types)

  - [2.1 Vault guardians](#Vault_guardians)
  - [2.2 Desolation guardians](#Desolation_guardians)
  - [2.3 Para-Humans](#Para-Humans)

- [3 Unique humans](#Unique_humans)

- [4 Obsolete humans](#Obsolete_humans)

## Generic humans

p [![Human (monster).png](/images/3/3b/Human_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Human_\(monster\).png) **[Human](/Human_\(monster\) "Human (monster)")** - Occasionally found tending [sheep](/Sheep "Sheep"), warming by fires, and generally eking out a meager existence in the Dungeon.

##### Generic human variants

- [![Deformed human.png](/images/4/4d/Deformed_human.png)](/File:Deformed_human.png) - All manner of **deformed** and **sickly humans** (and other species) can be found in [Cigotuvi's Fleshworks](/Cigotuvi%27s_Fleshworks "Cigotuvi's Fleshworks").

## Human types

p [![Wizard.png](/images/c/c7/Wizard.png)](/File:Wizard.png) **[Wizard](/Wizard_\(monster\) "Wizard (monster)")** - These eccentric magic-users possess an eclectic spell-set replete with dangerous conjurations and enchantments.

p [![Necromancer.png](/images/5/5d/Necromancer.png)](/File:Necromancer.png) **[Necromancer](/Necromancer_\(monster\) "Necromancer (monster)")** - Akin to the wizard, but with a focus on death magic. Generally come with an [undead](/Undead "Undead") entourage.

p [![Death knight.png](/images/d/da/Death_knight.png)](/File:Death_knight.png) **[Death knight](/Death_knight "Death knight")** - Warrior-priests of the dark god [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul") who can invoke necromantic powers. Often accompanied by several undead thralls.

p [![Master elementalist.png](/images/d/d8/Master_elementalist.png)](/File:Master_elementalist.png) **[Master elementalist](/Master_elementalist "Master elementalist")** - Exceptional mages who have mastered spells from all four schools of [elemental](/Element "Element") magic.

p [![Hell knight.png](/images/4/4c/Hell_knight.png)](/File:Hell_knight.png) **[Hell knight](/Hell_knight "Hell knight")** - Powerful warriors that employ the very fires of [Hell](/Hell "Hell") itself. Often found roaming the deeper portions of the Dungeon in groups.

#### [Vault](/The_Vaults "The Vaults") guardians

p [![Vault guard.png](/images/a/a8/Vault_guard.png)](/File:Vault_guard.png) **[Vault guard](/Vault_guard "Vault guard")** - Unexciting but durable foot soldiers armed with heavy weapons and sturdy armour.

p [![Vault sentinel.png](/images/6/69/Vault_sentinel.png)](/File:Vault_sentinel.png) **[Vault sentinel](/Vault_sentinel "Vault sentinel")** - Vigilant guards who can put the entirety of the Vaults on alert, then [mark intruders](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark") to ensure their elimination. May come with a [crossbow](/Crossbow "Crossbow").

p [![Ironbound convoker.png](/images/2/27/Ironbound_convoker.png)](/File:Ironbound_convoker.png) **[Ironbound convoker](/Ironbound_convoker "Ironbound convoker")** - Guardians that [recall](/Word_of_Recall "Word of Recall") and [strengthen](/Might_Other "Might Other") reinforcements from elsewhere on the floor.

p [![Ironbound frostheart.png](/images/2/27/Ironbound_frostheart.png)](/File:Ironbound_frostheart.png) **[Ironbound frostheart](/Ironbound_frostheart "Ironbound frostheart")** - Armored ice mages; their magics imbue nearby walls with lethal cold.

p [![Ironbound preserver.png](/images/4/42/Ironbound_preserver.png)](/File:Ironbound_preserver.png) **[Ironbound preserver](/Ironbound_preserver "Ironbound preserver")** - Support units that absorb part of the damage inflicted on their allies, effectively doubling their HP until the preserver dies.

p [![Vault warden.png](/images/0/05/Vault_warden.png)](/File:Vault_warden.png) **[Vault warden](/Vault_warden "Vault warden")** - Chief enforcers of the Vaults. They are entrusted with the ability to seal [doors](/Door "Door") and [stairs](/Stair "Stair"), trapping trespassers until one or the other dies.

#### [Desolation](/Desolation "Desolation") guardians

a [![Servant of whispers.png](/images/0/0f/Servant_of_whispers.png)](/File:Servant_of_whispers.png) **[Servant of whispers](/Servant_of_whispers "Servant of whispers")** - Forsaken monks that have learned to still the air and unleash divine thunder.

a [![Ragged hierophant.png](/images/8/84/Ragged_hierophant.png)](/File:Ragged_hierophant.png) **[Ragged hierophant](/Ragged_hierophant "Ragged hierophant")** - Mages that maintain and support the Desolation's [construct](/List_of_constructs "List of constructs") enforcers.

a [![Imperial myrmidon.png](/images/d/dc/Imperial_myrmidon.png)](/File:Imperial_myrmidon.png) **[Imperial myrmidon](/Imperial_myrmidon "Imperial myrmidon")** - Elite cultists which strip your [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") in preparation for their dangerous [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes").

#### Para-Humans

p [![Demigod.png](/images/6/63/Demigod.png)](/File:Demigod.png) **[Demigod](/Demigod_\(monster\) "Demigod (monster)")** - As a half-mortal, one of a demigod's parents is ostensibly of human ilk.

p [![Killer Klown.png](/images/1/12/Killer_Klown.png)](/File:Killer_Klown.png) **[Killer Klown](/Killer_Klown "Killer Klown")** - Pie-throwing fools that are nevertheless found among the most elite guardians of the [Realm of Zot](/Realm_of_Zot "Realm of Zot").

## Unique humans

@ [![Jessica.png](/images/e/e8/Jessica.png)](/File:Jessica.png) **[Jessica](/Jessica "Jessica")** - A low-level spellcaster who appears in the very early dungeon, preying on the weak.

@ [![Terence.png](/images/6/6c/Terence.png)](/File:Terence.png) **[Terence](/Terence "Terence")** - A violent murderer hiding out in the early dungeon, he is most threatening to weak, low-level characters.

@ [![Sigmund.png](/images/6/64/Sigmund.png)](/File:Sigmund.png) **[Sigmund](/Sigmund "Sigmund")** - An older, more dangerous brother to Edmund, his [scythe](/Scythe "Scythe") and spells are the bane of low-level characters.

@ [![Edmund.png](/images/0/0a/Edmund.png)](/File:Edmund.png) **[Edmund](/Edmund "Edmund")** - A weaker, younger brother to Sigmund who focuses entirely on melee combat with an enchanted [flail](/Flail "Flail").

@ [![Eustachio.png](/images/9/9e/Eustachio.png)](/File:Eustachio.png) **[Eustachio](/Eustachio "Eustachio")** - A magnificently mustachioed [summoner](/Summoner "Summoner") found early in the game.

F [![Prince Ribbit.png](/images/8/87/Prince_Ribbit.png)](/File:Prince_Ribbit.png) **[Prince Ribbit](/Prince_Ribbit "Prince Ribbit")** - His current [froggy](/Blink_frog "Blink frog") exterior belies his true form, which is only revealed to be human upon death.

@ [![Maggie.png](/images/8/89/Maggie.png)](/File:Maggie.png) **[Maggie](/Maggie "Maggie")** - An inexperienced adventuress who hopes to achieve glory through dragonslaying.

@ [![Joseph.png](/images/7/7a/Joseph.png)](/File:Joseph.png) **[Joseph](/Joseph "Joseph")** - A mercenary in a stupid hat who can hit hard with his [staff](/Staff "Staff") and [sling](/Sling "Sling").

@ [![Psyche.png](/images/a/a9/Psyche.png)](/File:Psyche.png) **[Psyche](/Psyche "Psyche")** - A winsome but unstable magess, Psyche comes with a mixed bag of chaotic [spells](/Spell "Spell") and a nasty [dagger](/Dagger "Dagger").

f [![Maurice.png](/images/4/45/Maurice.png)](/File:Maurice.png) **[Maurice](/Maurice "Maurice")** - A sly [thief](/Thief "Thief") capable of pick-pocketing his foes mid-combat.

x [![Erica.png](/images/8/8b/Erica.png)](/File:Erica.png) **[Erica](/Erica "Erica")** - An adventuress found in the mid-game; [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra")-slayers everywhere covet her [flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") blade.

@ [![Harold.png](/images/7/75/Harold.png)](/File:Harold.png) **[Harold](/Harold "Harold")** - A middle-aged bounty hunter nearing retirement; he specializes in [tracking](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark") and [trapping](/Throwing_net "Throwing net") his quarry.

@ [![Josephine.png](/images/f/f3/Josephine.png)](/File:Josephine.png) **[Josephine](/Josephine "Josephine")** - A withered, decaying [necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer") who travels with an entourage of [wraiths](/Wraith "Wraith").

@ [![Rupert.png](/images/f/fc/Rupert.png)](/File:Rupert.png) **[Rupert](/Rupert "Rupert")** - A wild [berserker](/Berserker "Berserker") with a devastating voice, Rupert charges headlong with a powerful, two-handed weapon.

@ [![Frances.png](/images/8/83/Frances.png)](/File:Frances.png) **[Frances](/Frances "Frances")** - A skilled warrior who once defeated a demon. She wrested her dark powers and demonic servants from said foe.

@ [![Kirke.png](/images/4/41/Kirke.png)](/File:Kirke.png) **[Kirke](/Kirke "Kirke")** - An enchantress bent on forcing unwary victims to join her herd of [hogs](/Hog "Hog").

@ [![Louise.png](/images/1/1f/Louise.png)](/File:Louise.png) **[Louise](/Louise "Louise")** - A sorceress who spent far too long in [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss") and is eager for others to share her fate.

@ [![Donald.png](/images/6/6f/Donald.png)](/File:Donald.png) **[Donald](/Donald "Donald")** - An irritable adventurer skilled at swimming; he often possesses a rare [shield of reflection](/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection").

@ [![Nikola.png](/images/3/3a/Nikola.png)](/File:Nikola.png) **[Nikola](/Nikola "Nikola")** - A mad scientist frightfully gifted at wielding [electrical](/Electricity "Electricity") magic.

@ [![Margery.png](/images/0/03/Margery.png)](/File:Margery.png) **[Margery](/Margery "Margery")** - A particularly skilled hell knight who has slain multiple [dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons") in single combat, judging by her dragonhide armour.

@ [![Frederick.png](/images/1/15/Frederick.png)](/File:Frederick.png) **[Frederick](/Frederick "Frederick")** - A powerful demigod who searches the lowest reaches of the Dungeon for worthy opponents.

@ [![Cloud Mage.png](/images/2/2a/Cloud_Mage.png)](/File:Cloud_Mage.png) **[Cloud Mage](/Cloud_Mage "Cloud Mage")** - Resident of the [Cloud Mages' Chambers](/Cloud_Mages%27_Chambers "Cloud Mages' Chambers") and exceptionally skilled with [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic").

@ [![Hellbinder.png](/images/0/08/Hellbinder.png)](/File:Hellbinder.png) **[Hellbinder](/Hellbinder "Hellbinder")** - Master of the [Hall of the Hellbinder](/Hall_of_the_Hellbinder "Hall of the Hellbinder"), their infernal incantations bring [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") and [demons](/Demon "Demon") upon their foes.

## Obsolete humans

@ [![Michael.png](/images/f/f3/Michael.png)](/File:Michael.png) **[Michael](/Michael "Michael")** - A departed spellcaster, as unremarkable as his name would suggest. Removed in [0.6](/0.6 "0.6").

@ [![Duane.png](/images/4/40/Duane.png)](/File:Duane.png) **[Duane](/Duane "Duane")** - A weak, large-eared mercenary who possessed a few minor spells. Removed in [0.8](/0.8 "0.8").

@ [![Norbert.png](/images/4/40/Norbert.png)](/File:Norbert.png) **[Norbert](/Norbert "Norbert")** - A monster-slaying warrior who would deem your character as such. Removed in [0.8](/0.8 "0.8").

@ [![Francis.png](/images/4/4d/Francis.png)](/File:Francis.png) **[Francis](/Francis "Francis")** - A wizened wizard who could summon dangerous [demons](/Demon "Demon"). Removed in [0.8](/0.8 "0.8").

@ [![Jozef.png](/images/6/68/Jozef.png)](/File:Jozef.png) **[Jozef](/Jozef "Jozef")** - A tall bounty hunter who was known for vexing characters with a number of [traps](/Trap "Trap") and tricks. Removed in [0.11](/0.11 "0.11").

@ [![Paladin (monster).png](/images/d/d8/Paladin_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Paladin_\(monster\).png) **[Paladin](/Paladin_\(monster\) "Paladin (monster)")** - A very rare [holy](/Holy "Holy") monster, complete with [halo](/Halo "Halo"), who was on a quest for [The Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One"). Removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").

@ [![Maud.png](/images/6/68/Maud.png)](/File:Maud.png) **[Maud](/Maud "Maud")** - A female warrior known as much for her weaponry as anything else. Removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").

@ [![Norris.png](/images/b/bb/Norris.png)](/File:Norris.png) **[Norris](/Norris "Norris")** - A cultist armed with brain and brawn, Norris charged headlong into death. Removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").

p [![Slave.png](/images/e/e4/Slave.png)](/File:Slave.png) **[Slave](/Slave "Slave")** - Held in [Pikel](/Pikel "Pikel")'s thrall, these pathetic figures were a threat to low-level characters but would be freed if their master died. Replaced with [lemures](/Lemure "Lemure") in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26").

p [![Ironbound beastmaster.png](/images/a/a6/Ironbound_beastmaster.png)](/File:Ironbound_beastmaster.png) **[Ironbound beastmaster](/Ironbound_beastmaster "Ironbound beastmaster")** - A warrior who mastered the art of taming dangerous beasts and could command several such creatures in battle. Removed in [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")
html:
List of humans

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

The benchmark species against which others are compared, humans play a major, though somewhat inconspicuous role in the far-flung realms of Dungeon Crawl. Aside from a somewhat increased presence as specialized guardians of the Vaults, humans tend to be scattered widely across the Dungeon and its branches, arriving most often as unique, individually-named foes rather than as generic types of monster - they are arguably the one species best represented in this way.

The following is a list of humans appearing as monsters in all their various incarnations across Dungeon Crawl:

Contents

  • 1 Generic humans
    • 1.1 Generic human variants
  • 2 Human types
    • 2.1 Vault guardians
    • 2.2 Desolation guardians
    • 2.3 Para-Humans
  • 3 Unique humans
  • 4 Obsolete humans

Generic humans

p Human - Occasionally found tending sheep, warming by fires, and generally eking out a meager existence in the Dungeon.

Generic human variants
- All manner of deformed and sickly humans (and other species) can be found in Cigotuvi's Fleshworks.

Human types

p Wizard - These eccentric magic-users possess an eclectic spell-set replete with dangerous conjurations and enchantments.

p Necromancer - Akin to the wizard, but with a focus on death magic. Generally come with an undead entourage.

p Death knight - Warrior-priests of the dark god Yredelemnul who can invoke necromantic powers. Often accompanied by several undead thralls.

p Master elementalist - Exceptional mages who have mastered spells from all four schools of elemental magic.

p Hell knight - Powerful warriors that employ the very fires of Hell itself. Often found roaming the deeper portions of the Dungeon in groups.

Vault guardians

p Vault guard - Unexciting but durable foot soldiers armed with heavy weapons and sturdy armour.

p Vault sentinel - Vigilant guards who can put the entirety of the Vaults on alert, then mark intruders to ensure their elimination. May come with a crossbow.

p Ironbound convoker - Guardians that recall and strengthen reinforcements from elsewhere on the floor.

p Ironbound frostheart - Armored ice mages; their magics imbue nearby walls with lethal cold.

p Ironbound preserver - Support units that absorb part of the damage inflicted on their allies, effectively doubling their HP until the preserver dies.

p Vault warden - Chief enforcers of the Vaults. They are entrusted with the ability to seal doors and stairs, trapping trespassers until one or the other dies.

Desolation guardians

a Servant of whispers - Forsaken monks that have learned to still the air and unleash divine thunder.

a Ragged hierophant - Mages that maintain and support the Desolation's construct enforcers.

a Imperial myrmidon - Elite cultists which strip your willpower in preparation for their dangerous Hexes.

Para-Humans

p Demigod - As a half-mortal, one of a demigod's parents is ostensibly of human ilk.

p Killer Klown - Pie-throwing fools that are nevertheless found among the most elite guardians of the Realm of Zot.

Unique humans

@ Jessica - A low-level spellcaster who appears in the very early dungeon, preying on the weak.

@ Terence - A violent murderer hiding out in the early dungeon, he is most threatening to weak, low-level characters.

@ Sigmund - An older, more dangerous brother to Edmund, his scythe and spells are the bane of low-level characters.

@ Edmund - A weaker, younger brother to Sigmund who focuses entirely on melee combat with an enchanted flail.

@ Eustachio - A magnificently mustachioed summoner found early in the game.

F Prince Ribbit - His current froggy exterior belies his true form, which is only revealed to be human upon death.

@ Maggie - An inexperienced adventuress who hopes to achieve glory through dragonslaying.

@ Joseph - A mercenary in a stupid hat who can hit hard with his staff and sling.

@ Psyche - A winsome but unstable magess, Psyche comes with a mixed bag of chaotic spells and a nasty dagger.

f Maurice - A sly thief capable of pick-pocketing his foes mid-combat.

x Erica - An adventuress found in the mid-game; hydra-slayers everywhere covet her flaming blade.

@ Harold - A middle-aged bounty hunter nearing retirement; he specializes in tracking and trapping his quarry.

@ Josephine - A withered, decaying necromancer who travels with an entourage of wraiths.

@ Rupert - A wild berserker with a devastating voice, Rupert charges headlong with a powerful, two-handed weapon.

@ Frances - A skilled warrior who once defeated a demon. She wrested her dark powers and demonic servants from said foe.

@ Kirke - An enchantress bent on forcing unwary victims to join her herd of hogs.

@ Louise - A sorceress who spent far too long in the Abyss and is eager for others to share her fate.

@ Donald - An irritable adventurer skilled at swimming; he often possesses a rare shield of reflection.

@ Nikola - A mad scientist frightfully gifted at wielding electrical magic.

@ Margery - A particularly skilled hell knight who has slain multiple dragons in single combat, judging by her dragonhide armour.

@ Frederick - A powerful demigod who searches the lowest reaches of the Dungeon for worthy opponents.

@ Cloud Mage - Resident of the Cloud Mages' Chambers and exceptionally skilled with Air Magic.

@ Hellbinder - Master of the Hall of the Hellbinder, their infernal incantations bring damnation and demons upon their foes.

Obsolete humans

@ Michael - A departed spellcaster, as unremarkable as his name would suggest. Removed in 0.6.

@ Duane - A weak, large-eared mercenary who possessed a few minor spells. Removed in 0.8.

@ Norbert - A monster-slaying warrior who would deem your character as such. Removed in 0.8.

@ Francis - A wizened wizard who could summon dangerous demons. Removed in 0.8.

@ Jozef - A tall bounty hunter who was known for vexing characters with a number of traps and tricks. Removed in 0.11.

@ Paladin - A very rare holy monster, complete with halo, who was on a quest for The Shining One. Removed in 0.13.

@ Maud - A female warrior known as much for her weaponry as anything else. Removed in 0.19.

@ Norris - A cultist armed with brain and brawn, Norris charged headlong into death. Removed in 0.19.

p Slave - Held in Pikel's thrall, these pathetic figures were a threat to low-level characters but would be freed if their master died. Replaced with lemures in 0.26.

p Ironbound beastmaster - A warrior who mastered the art of taming dangerous beasts and could command several such creatures in battle. Removed in 0.28

Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=List_of_humans&oldid=60557"

rawPage:
{{version028}}
The benchmark species against which others are compared, '''humans''' play a major, though somewhat inconspicuous role in the far-flung realms of ''Dungeon Crawl''. Aside from a somewhat increased presence as specialized guardians of [[the Vaults]], humans tend to be scattered widely across the [[Dungeon]] and its [[branch]]es, arriving most often as unique, individually-named foes rather than as generic types of monster - they are arguably the one species best represented in this way.

The following is a list of humans appearing as monsters in all their various incarnations across ''Dungeon Crawl'':

==Generic humans==
{{LightGrey|p}} [[File:Human (monster).png]] '''[[Human (monster)|Human]]''' - Occasionally found tending [[sheep]], warming by fires, and generally eking out a meager existence in the Dungeon.

=====Generic human variants=====
:[[File:Deformed human.png]] - All manner of '''deformed''' and '''sickly humans''' (and other species) can be found in [[Cigotuvi's Fleshworks]].

==Human types==
{{Magenta|p}} [[File:Wizard (monster).png]] '''[[Wizard (monster)|Wizard]]''' - These eccentric magic-users possess an eclectic spell-set replete with dangerous conjurations and enchantments.

{{White|p}} [[File:Necromancer (monster).png]] '''[[Necromancer (monster)|Necromancer]]''' - Akin to the wizard, but with a focus on death magic. Generally come with an [[undead]] entourage.

{{monsterlink|Death knight}} - Warrior-priests of the dark god [[Yredelemnul]] who can invoke necromantic powers. Often accompanied by several undead thralls.

{{monsterlink|Master elementalist}} - Exceptional mages who have mastered spells from all four schools of [[element]]al magic.

{{monsterlink|Hell knight}} - Powerful warriors that employ the very fires of [[Hell]] itself. Often found roaming the deeper portions of the Dungeon in groups.

====[[The Vaults|Vault]] guardians====
{{monsterlink|Vault guard}} - Unexciting but durable foot soldiers armed with heavy weapons and sturdy armour.

{{monsterlink|Vault sentinel}} - Vigilant guards who can put the entirety of the Vaults on alert, then [[Sentinel's Mark|mark intruders]] to ensure their elimination. May come with a [[crossbow]].

{{monsterlink|Ironbound convoker}} - Guardians that [[Word of Recall|recall]] and [[Might Other|strengthen]] reinforcements from elsewhere on the floor.

{{monsterlink|Ironbound frostheart}} - Armored ice mages; their magics imbue nearby walls with lethal cold.

{{monsterlink|Ironbound preserver}} - Support units that absorb part of the damage inflicted on their allies, effectively doubling their HP until the preserver dies.

{{monsterlink|Vault warden}} - Chief enforcers of the Vaults. They are entrusted with the ability to seal [[door]]s and [[stair]]s, trapping trespassers until one or the other dies.

====[[Desolation]] guardians====
{{monsterlink|Servant of whispers}} - Forsaken monks that have learned to still the air and unleash divine thunder.

{{monsterlink|Ragged hierophant}} - Mages that maintain and support the Desolation's [[list of constructs|construct]] enforcers.

{{monsterlink|Imperial myrmidon}} - Elite cultists which strip your [[willpower]] in preparation for their dangerous [[Hexes]].

====Para-Humans====
{{Yellow|p}} [[File:Demigod (monster).png]] '''[[Demigod (monster)|Demigod]]''' - As a half-mortal, one of a demigod's parents is ostensibly of human ilk.

{{monsterlink|Killer Klown}} - Pie-throwing fools that are nevertheless found among the most elite guardians of the [[Realm of Zot]].

==Unique humans==
{{monsterlink|Jessica}} - A low-level spellcaster who appears in the very early dungeon, preying on the weak. 

{{monsterlink|Terence}} - A violent murderer hiding out in the early dungeon, he is most threatening to weak, low-level characters.

{{monsterlink|Sigmund}} - An older, more dangerous brother to Edmund, his [[scythe]] and spells are the bane of low-level characters.

{{monsterlink|Edmund}} - A weaker, younger brother to Sigmund who focuses entirely on melee combat with an enchanted [[flail]].

{{monsterlink|Eustachio}} - A magnificently mustachioed [[summoner]] found early in the game.

{{monsterlink|Prince Ribbit}} - His current [[blink frog|froggy]] exterior belies his true form, which is only revealed to be human upon death.

{{monsterlink|Maggie}} - An inexperienced adventuress who hopes to achieve glory through dragonslaying.

{{monsterlink|Joseph}} - A mercenary in a stupid hat who can hit hard with his [[staff]] and [[sling]].

{{monsterlink|Psyche}} - A winsome but unstable magess, Psyche comes with a mixed bag of chaotic [[spell]]s and a nasty [[dagger]].

{{monsterlink|Maurice}} - A sly [[thief]] capable of pick-pocketing his foes mid-combat.

{{monsterlink|Erica}} - An adventuress found in the mid-game; [[hydra]]-slayers everywhere covet her [[flaming]] blade.

{{monsterlink|Harold}} - A middle-aged bounty hunter nearing retirement; he specializes in [[Sentinel's Mark|tracking]] and [[throwing net|trapping]] his quarry.

{{monsterlink|Josephine}} - A withered, decaying [[necromancer]] who travels with an entourage of [[wraith]]s.

{{monsterlink|Rupert}} - A wild [[berserker]] with a devastating voice, Rupert charges headlong with a powerful, two-handed weapon.

{{monsterlink|Frances}} - A skilled warrior who once defeated a demon. She wrested her dark powers and demonic servants from said foe.

{{monsterlink|Kirke}} - An enchantress bent on forcing unwary victims to join her herd of [[hog]]s.

{{monsterlink|Louise}} - A sorceress who spent far too long in [[the Abyss]] and is eager for others to share her fate.

{{monsterlink|Donald}} - An irritable adventurer skilled at swimming; he often possesses a rare [[shield of reflection]].

{{monsterlink|Nikola}} - A mad scientist frightfully gifted at wielding [[Electricity|electrical]] magic.

{{monsterlink|Margery}} - A particularly skilled hell knight who has slain multiple [[list of dragons|dragons]] in single combat, judging by her dragonhide armour.

{{monsterlink|Frederick}} - A powerful demigod who searches the lowest reaches of the Dungeon for worthy opponents.

{{monsterlink|Cloud Mage}} - Resident of the [[Cloud Mages' Chambers]] and exceptionally skilled with [[Air Magic]].

{{monsterlink|Hellbinder}} - Master of the [[Hall of the Hellbinder]], their infernal incantations bring [[damnation]] and [[demon]]s upon their foes.

==Obsolete humans==
{{LightGrey|@}} [[Image:Michael.png]] '''[[Michael]]''' - A departed spellcaster, as unremarkable as his name would suggest. Removed in [[0.6]].

{{Yellow|@}} [[Image:Duane.png]] '''[[Duane]]''' - A weak, large-eared mercenary who possessed a few minor spells. Removed in [[0.8]].

{{Brown|@}} [[Image:Norbert.png]] '''[[Norbert]]''' - A monster-slaying warrior who would deem your character as such. Removed in [[0.8]].

{{Yellow|@}} [[Image:Francis.png]] '''[[Francis]]''' - A wizened wizard who could summon dangerous [[demon]]s. Removed in [[0.8]].

{{LightMagenta|@}} [[Image:Jozef.png]] '''[[Jozef]]''' - A tall bounty hunter who was known for vexing characters with a number of [[trap]]s and tricks. Removed in [[0.11]].

{{White|@}} [[Image:Paladin (monster).png]] '''[[Paladin (monster)|Paladin]]''' - A very rare [[holy]] monster, complete with [[halo]], who was on a quest for [[The Shining One]]. Removed in [[0.13]].

{{monsterlink|Maud}} - A female warrior known as much for her weaponry as anything else. Removed in [[0.19]].

{{monsterlink|Norris}} - A cultist armed with brain and brawn, Norris charged headlong into death. Removed in [[0.19]].

{{monsterlink|Slave}} - Held in [[Pikel]]'s thrall, these pathetic figures were a threat to low-level characters but would be freed if their master died. Replaced with [[lemure]]s in [[0.26]].

{{monsterlink|Ironbound beastmaster}} - A warrior who mastered the art of taming dangerous beasts and could command several such creatures in battle. Removed in [[0.28]]
